ingredients.ingredient: 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
salt and ground black pepper to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

gear.name: Heavy-bottomed Dutch oven or large pot

cookingTips: Use authentic Hungarian paprika (sweet or hot) as it's essential to the dish's flavor; regular paprika is not a substitute
Slowly cook onions in lard until very soft and golden before adding meat to build flavor base
Simmer gently for 1.5-2 hours until beef is very tender; longer cooking develops deeper flavors
enrichment.coachingPrompt: Explain the importance of quality Hungarian paprika and proper caramelization of onions. Suggest this is a perfect make-ahead stew that improves with time.
